title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest earned the No. 55 jersey at USC, a tradition initiated by Junior Seau.
McGinest wore No. 55 with the Patriots from 1994-2005, appearing in four Super Bowls and winning three.
Junior Seau wore No. 55 after McGinest left, with Bill Belichick's blessing following a respectful exchange.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County received the highest snow totals, with Salisbury and Beverly recording 13 inches each.
Bristol County's highest snow accumulation was 8.2 inches in Dartmouth, reported by a public observer.
Most heavy snowfall was concentrated in northeastern Massachusetts, impacting towns like Middleton with 12 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC, featuring the Patriots vs. Seahawks in Santa Clara.
Tirico's broadcast team includes Cris Collinsworth, with pregame hosted by Maria Taylor and analysts like Devin McCourty.
After the Super Bowl, Tirico will host NBC's Olympic coverage from Levi's Stadium, juggling multiple high-profile assignments.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium, Santa Clara, California.
This marks the second Super Bowl meeting between Patriots and Seahawks; Patriots won the first encounter in Super Bowl XLIX.
Quarterback Drake Maye aims to be youngest to win Super Bowl; faced 15 sacks this postseason, most since 1970 merger.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel consulted with Bill Belichick and Andy Reid ahead of Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
Vrabel, preparing for his first Super Bowl as coach, also seeks advice from offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels.
Vrabel led the Patriots to a 14-win season and won Coach of the Year after back-to-back four-win seasons.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: A Patriots win would set the NFL record for most Super Bowl victories by a franchise, surpassing Pittsburgh.
Drake Maye aims to become the first quarterback since 2014 to win a Super Bowl in his second season.
Mike Vrabel could be the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs, Patriots wide receiver, hopes a Super Bowl LX win boosts his Hall of Fame chances.
Diggs has been named a Pro Bowler four times and earned one first-team All-Pro honor.
Diggs ranks 38th in all-time receiving yards and 43rd in touchdowns, with potential to improve.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots and one with the Colts, scoring 2,673 points over 24 seasons.
Key moments include a crucial 45-yard field goal against the Raiders in 2002, leading to his Hall of Fame recognition.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Coach Mike Vrabel simulated a long Super Bowl halftime during Patriots' final practice at Stanford Stadium.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye practiced fully, while Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited due to injuries.
Rumors suggest Cardi B may join Bad Bunny at the Super Bowl halftime show, but Patriots' Stefon Diggs did not confirm.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Drake Maye of the Patriots and Sam Darnold of the Seahawks face off in Super Bowl LX.
Maye has three postseason wins against top-five defenses, but had turnover issues earlier in playoffs.
Sam Darnold excelled in NFC Championship, despite high regular season interception and fumble rates.
